channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge Blocks Government From Reviewing Seized Washington Post Devices
item.description: The Post, in its first legal filing since the government searched the home of a reporter last week, had demanded the return of the seized materials.

item.title: Supreme Court Seems Poised to Reject Trump’s Attempt to Immediately Fire a Fed Governor
item.description: During arguments, key justices appeared concerned that the president’s efforts to oust Lisa Cook could imperil the central bank’s independence.

item.title: U.S. Starts Moving ISIS Detainees From Syria to Iraq
item.description: The U.S. military said it had transferred 150 Islamic State detainees from northeastern Syria to Iraq and could eventually move as many as 7,000, as t...

item.title: Trump finds a ‘solution’ to Greenland crisis, backs off on 10% tariff threats
item.description: Trump has repeatedly said that anything less than controlling all of Greenland is "unacceptable."

item.title: Iran’s Protests Have Been Completely Squashed, Government Says
item.description: After a crackdown that killed thousands, Iran’s prosecutor general said on Wednesday that “the sedition is over now,” vowing to punish those responsib...

item.title: The Walmart C-suite reshuffle shows how the retailer sees itself now: as a tech company
item.description: The retail giant is bolstering its tech cred with a focus on AI and e-commerce, and a major appointment.

item.title: The rise of on-demand leadership in the AI economy
item.description: Companies are favoring experienced consultants over permanent roles as judgment becomes more valuable than execution.

item.title: Trump says Europe does one thing right: drug prices. ‘A pill that costs $10 in London costs $130 in New York or Los Angeles’
item.description: The president called out French President Emmanuel Macron on refusing to raise drug prices, and claimed tariff threats make Macron change his mind.

item.title: Why Coinbase split with Andreessen Horowitz and the crypto industry on a key bill—and what’s next for the Clarity Act
item.description: CEO Brian Armstrong’s move to pull support for a Clarity Act draft risks alienating key political allies.

item.title: Trump Administration Starts Immigration Operation in Maine
item.description: A similar operation that unfolded in Minnesota became a flashpoint between protesters and immigration authorities.

item.title: U.S. Starts Moving ISIS Detainees From Syria to Iraq
item.description: The U.S. military said it had transferred 150 Islamic State detainees from northeastern Syria to Iraq and could eventually move as many as 7,000, as t...

item.title: Majority of Latin Americans Endorsed Trump’s Intervention In Venezuela, Polls Show
item.description: A majority of those surveyed said they support the intervention, suggesting a shift from ideology to pragmatism, at least for now.

item.title: Iran’s Protests Have Been Completely Squashed, Government Says
item.description: After a crackdown that killed thousands, Iran’s prosecutor general said on Wednesday that “the sedition is over now,” vowing to punish those responsib...

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Drops Tariff Threat Over Greenland After Assailing Europe
Trump’s Moves on Greenland
item.description: After assailing Europe in a long speech at Davos, the president said he had won an agreement on the future of the Arctic territory.
